Change has been successfully merged
Hmmm should we use managed fd https://github.com/openbmc/stdplus/blob/7aa2a42be328438726a2aff665d649444a1a54d4/include-fd/stdplus/fd/managed.hpp#L28
I am working on a CL on top to do that.
Updated it in https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/ipmi-blob-tool/+/72782
I guess you don't need to reset this once_flag since you already throw an exception below so the "done" flag isn't set in this case and this function will be called again.
Yeah, added unit tests to make sure the behavior is expected.
this is not working as expected.

Tested it out with unit tests and works as expected.

Basically want to make sure that it block the other thread until the current once finished... and if the current one failed... it will call again instead of skipping it.
lock_guard should also protect `if (fd < 0)` otherwise open() will be called twice/multiple times.
never mind, my above comments are wrong

I think you are right. There could be multiple thread that pass the (fd < 0) check and run open() multiple times.

We needed the lock_guard inside open() because TSAN would still think open() in unsafe otherwise.

I'll just add back the 

if (fd >= 0 )

check in open() and it would fix the issue.
Done
Awesome, thanks for making this a much better / safer handler. All my comments are mostly nits, but would be nice to haves to put in comments
very minor nit: I guess you could use `fd`
I think it could be good to explain why you return on third try in comment
Done
Done
how was 200ms chosen?
I changed it to 10ms and just need some delay to make sure that the second thread starts after the first thread starts.
question: Is there merit in testing 1 successful, 1 not successful thread?

this is actually wrong. I meant to use `ExpectSendPacketError`.

But yeah, I am updating the test to make sure that the second one will get the proper fd.

Updated and caught more data race and was fixed.
Cool this is much better
